commit_message:
bagpipe driver: use OVO-based push/pull RPCs

This change updates bagpipe driver to use OVO RPCs based on
the OVO objects introduced by Ie0f1c9f3f2bd1cf317b921ee1c1691c2816d8832.

The old-style RPCs are still produced to allow
an upgrade path involving not-yet-upgraded agents.

Co-Authored-By: Omar Sanhaji <sanhaji.omar@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>

Partial Implements: blueprint bagpipe-bgpvpn-ovo

Change-Id: I2a6f6be511c8a729c50c9c82fba3972f893367ec
Depends-On: Ie0f1c9f3f2bd1cf317b921ee1c1691c2816d8832
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/46/499946/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.api.rpc.callbacks.producer import registry as pull_registryfrom networking_bagpipe.objects import bgpvpn as bgpvpn_object from neutron.api.rpc.callbacks import events as rpc_events from neutron.api.rpc.callbacks import resources as resources_objects from neutron.api.rpc.handlers import resources_rpcdef _get_associations(resource, data, context, **kwargs): net_id = data['network_id'] assocs = bgpvpn_object.BGPVPNAssociations.get_objects( context, network_id=net_id) return assocs self.setup_rpc() def delete_bgpvpn_precommit(self, context, bgpvpn): net_assoc_obj_list = [] router_assoc_obj_list = [] for net_id in bgpvpn['networks']: net_assoc_obj = bgpvpn_object.BGPVPNNetAssociation.get_object( context, network_id=net_id, bgpvpn_id=bgpvpn['id']) net_assoc_obj_list.append(net_assoc_obj) if not net_assoc_obj: router_assoc_obj_list.append( bgpvpn_object.BGPVPNRouterAssociation.get_objects( context, network_id=net_id)) self._push_rpc.push(context, net_assoc_obj_list, rpc_events.DELETED) self._push_rpc.push(context, router_assoc_obj_list, rpc_events.DELETED) assoc_obj = bgpvpn_object.BGPVPNNetAssociation.get_objects( context, network_id=net_id, bgpvpn_id=bgpvpn['id']) if not assoc_obj: assoc_obj = bgpvpn_object.BGPVPNRouterAssociation.get_objects( context, network_id=net_id, bgpvpn_id=bgpvpn['id']) self._push_rpc.push(context, assoc_obj, rpc_events.UPDATED) def delete_net_assoc_precommit(self, context, net_assoc): assoc_obj = bgpvpn_object.BGPVPNNetAssociation.get_objects( context, network_id=net_assoc['network_id'], bgpvpn_id=net_assoc['bgpvpn_id']) if not assoc_obj: assoc_obj = bgpvpn_object.BGPVPNRouterAssociation.get_objects( context, _pager=None, validate_filters=True, network_id=net_assoc['network_id']) self._push_rpc.push(context, assoc_obj, rpc_events.DELETED) def delete_router_assoc_precommit(self, context, router_assoc): ports = get_router_ports(context, router_assoc['router_id']) if ports: net_ids = set([port['network_id'] for port in ports]) for net_id in net_ids: net_assoc = {'network_id': net_id, 'bgpvpn_id': router_assoc['bgpvpn_id']} self.delete_net_assoc_precommit(context, net_assoc) def setup_rpc(self): self._push_rpc = resources_rpc.ResourcesPushRpcApi() pull_registry.provide(_get_associations, resources_objects.BGPVPNAssociations)

commit_message:
Case insentitive MAC address matching in OsNetConfigMappings

OsNetConfigMappings should be case insensitive in
os-net-config-mappings.yaml
This patch casts all MAC addresses to lower case.

Change-Id: Ide18660a3a8063cfdf53500cd727c8f49407b436
Closes-Bug: 1709653
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/44/492244/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Match on mac addresses first - cast all to lower case eth_addr='$eth_addr'.lower() lc_interface_mapping = copy.deepcopy(interface_mapping) for key,x in lc_interface_mapping['interface_mapping'].iteritems(): lc_interface_mapping['interface_mapping'][key] = x.lower() if any(x in eth_addr.split(',') for x in lc_interface_mapping['interface_mapping'].values()): write_mapping_file(lc_interface_mapping)
deleted_lines: # Match on mac addresses first if any(x in '$eth_addr'.split(',') for x in data[node].values()): write_mapping_file(interface_mapping)

Fix infra docs building

The infra docs post jobs fail now since sphinx_doc_build is undefined,
rename to sphinx_build_dir - following change
I7c3d578a00a4aa4c9e175f5f83e3171c6f6a4a61.

Change-Id: Ib8c922f68a5b5f43d5b17e702020f0c31d641508

commit_message:
Add sphinxcontrib.datatemplates

This package has been used for some time by the releases repo,
but installed via extras in setup.cfg. With the switch to not
installing projects to run docs jobs, those now fail due to
missing requirements.

As the first step to get these defined in requirements.txt,
adding to global-requirements and upper-constraints.


* Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, Doug Hellmann is the author and all source is available
on github.

* Is the library good code?

Code is well documented and tested.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

* Is the library license compatible?

Yes, it is using the BSD license.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

I don't believe so, but this is not a runtime dependency for
any projects. So far, I am only aware of the releases repo
using it for some of our release cycle publishing.

* Is the function of this library already, et cetera?

Nope.

Change-Id: Ib882a4d09898ff206b36ac8aef840bee0748368e

commit_message:
Drop postgresql support

Remove postgresql DB support; This feature is untested as part
of the charms, is not in use and was deprecated as part of
the 1708 charms release.

Change-Id: Ia197a37cbfe9c11538f272437d95cfc836768cc9

commit_message:
Add MTU adjustment parameters to RDO Cloud settings

MTU values are defined for RH1 but not for RDO Cloud.
This review adds those settings for RDO Cloud.

Depends-On: I1c602404fda14262adee6b6c922e6321776fa921

commit_message:
Adding httpd-worker apache process on SLES

The apache2 process on SLES might be 'httpd-worker'. Otherwise
while running monasca-setup, the error is:
     ERROR: Apache process does not exist.

Change-Id: I27c757b9c3c3b93db7b3edd8e576147e94c32a4a
(cherry picked from commit f3410a4475d0ef29168e9f366a204619a5e0d220)

added_lines: # on openSUSE/SLES it might be httpd-prefork or httpd-worker APACHE_PROCESS_NAMES = ('apache2', 'httpd', 'httpd-prefork', 'httpd-worker')
deleted_lines: # on openSUSE/SLES it might be httpd-prefork APACHE_PROCESS_NAMES = ('apache2', 'httpd', 'httpd-prefork')

commit_message:
[WIP] Add test cases for volume attachment

Volume attachment APIs are implemented in volume v3, and the
min_microversion for these APIs is 3.27. This patch is to add test cases
for these new features.

Including:

[1] Add v3 attachments_client as library
[2] Add unit tests for volume attachment APIs
[3] Add test case: test_volume_attachment_create_show_list_delete
[4] Add release note

Change-Id: I51d38a4e999b42bbad6b78443201893a410eefb1

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-14 02:34:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/3e66eba1976479ffe943c405cf33f79604126d50', 'message': "[WIP] Remove reliance on NeutronException message field

removed in PY3.0 [1]. Should Neutron code abandon its use of this
field, it will break current Octavia code.

commit_message:
Remove reliance on NeutronException message field

The 'message' class member in Exception was deprecated in PY2.6 and
removed in PY3.0 [1]. Should Neutron code abandon its use of this
field, it will break current Octavia code.
This patch shields Octavia of such change, replacing exc.message
calls with exc.__str__().

[1] - https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/

Change-Id: Ia7836f0d68e20d9964334bc41f7789efd1007939

commit_message:
Convert tox job to native v3 Zuul

Use a native Zuul v3 jobs for the tox job. Remove the now unused
playbooks.

Also, add file extensions to playbooks, these are required now.

Fix bindep.txt file:
* Update package liberasurecode-devel, it does not exist in CentOS 7.
* Update package yasm, it does not exist in CentOS 7.

Change-Id: Ib576497058637b01d63bda3f5369527fe2505e01

commit_message:
Add extra-specs-image-meta-conflicts spec

Change-Id: I5ba3951f4d40285e5810c999eb5c38b8ac9df4bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/82/382382/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================================== Consistent extra spec-image metadata conflict handling ====================================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/extra-specs-image-meta-conflicts Many of the filter scheduler's filters provide customization via a combination of image metadata and flavor extra specs. However, how nova handles conflicts between these two sources is haphazard at best. nova should raise exceptions any time a user specifies a flavor extra specs that conflicts with a non-default image metadata settings. Problem description =================== Take two NUMA-related properties: * CPU allocation policy Image: ``hw:cpu_thread_policy`` Flavor: ``hw:cpu_thread_policy`` Values: ``shared`` (softer, default), ``dedicated`` (stricter) * CPU thread allocation policy Image: ``hw:cpu_thread_policy`` Flavor: ``hw:cpu_thread_policy`` Values: ``prefer`` (softer, default), ``isolate`` (medium), ``require`` (stricter) The behaviour in case of conflicts [1]_: * CPU allocation policy: ========= ========= ================================ flavor image result ========= ========= ================================ dedicated shared dedicated (stricter, non-default) shared dedicated exception ========= ========= ================================ * CPU thread allocation policy: ========= =============== ================================ flavor image result ========= =============== ================================ prefer isolate/require prefer (softer, default) isolate prefer/require exception require prefer/isolate exception ========= =============== ================================ We have two rather different behaviors for NUMA related properties. If first case we prefer stricter non-default value, but in second case we prefer softer default value. The only phrase in spec for these paricular policies [2]_ regarding handling of conflicts is: Image property will only be honoured if the flavor does not already have a threads policy set. This ensures the cloud administrator can have absolute control over threads policy if desired. This should be clearly defined but it isn't. The same issue occurs in other specs. Use Cases --------- * As a user, I want to know what will happen if I a conflict occurs between image metadata and flavor extra specs * As an administrator, I want to prevent users overriding important image metadata * As a developer, I want a clearly defined pattern for handling image metadata/flavor extra spec conflicts Proposed change =============== This change will be a two stage process. In the first stage, a warning will be issued when a user tries to set a conflicting option for any of the image metadata/flavor extra spec options. The documentation will be updated warning users about this new behavior. In the second stage, the warning will be replaced with exceptions. This will ensure the user can no longer specify conflicting options without error. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- Deployers may see new warnings when deploying images with some metadata set against flavors with competing extra specs. However, actual behavior of existing options will not change. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com> Work Items ---------- #. Add warnings to all locations where image metadata and flavor extra specs are compared and conflicts arise #. Update documentation to reflect this requirement Then, in the following cycle. #. Replace the warnings with exceptions. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Unit tests should suffice. Documentation Impact ==================== * The flavor and image metadata guides will need to be updated to alert the user to potential issues. * Any guides that reference both flavor extra specs and image metadata may need to be updated. References ========== None. History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Ocata - Introduced .. [1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/juno/approved/virt-driver-cpu-pinning.html .. [2] http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/compute-flavors.html

With the move to zuulv3, the openstack-tox-py* job definitions

Run doc8 from the pep8 target.  Also drop the spell check job
since the way it is implemented causes the doc8 job to fail and

commit_message:
Remove unit test targets

With the move to zuulv3, the openstack-tox-py* job definitions
ignore doc only changes so we do not get spec
linters run as part of the py27 and py35 targets any more.

Run doc8 from the pep8 target.  Also drop the spell check job
since the way it is implemented causes the doc8 job to fail and
the optional spellcheck job was not useful as a practial quick
check anyways since it reported over 1000 "misspellings" because
OpenStack vocabulary contains many words and acronyms not in its
dictionary.

Corresponding changes have been proposed for nova [1] and
cinder [2].

[1] Ic87e79db6a8881398d670148b609e0b81658dfd1
[2] Ida20764edde3a07c89703d82b41958c96548b239

Change-Id: I82c8dbec713fc5575fd03c0ae290bf190bbdf8ca

commit_message:
Add support for monasca-ui metrics API proxy

This commit adds support for the Monasca API proxy provided by
the monasca-ui Horizon plugin. This Horizon plugin combined
with direct access in the Monasca data source allows using a
user's Horizon session for authenticating and authorizing
access to the Monasca API.

Change-Id: I98bd8ff7bcc55dcd911e87037b64840035542155
Story: 2001305
Task: 5856
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-grafana-datasource refs/changes/66/513366/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## Authentication Options ### Horizon Session The [monasca-ui](https://github.com/openstack/monasca-ui) Horizon plugin offers Horizon integration for Monasca. Among other things this plugin proxies the Monasca Metrics API, using the Horizon session for authentication (as opposed to a Keystone token). This proxied API can be used to implement Horizon based single sign-on for this plugin. Doing this takes some effort: 1. Install and configure the `monasca-ui` Horizon plugin 2. Configure the VHost hosting your Horizon instance with a proxy path that points at your Grafana instance (the example assumes you are running Horizon on Apache - adapt as required for other web servers): ``` ProxyPass "/grafana" "http://my.grafana.server:3000" ProxyPassReverse "/grafana" "http://my.grafana.server:3000" ``` 3. Configure Grafana's `[server/root_url] setting to point at your dashboard node's `/grafana` path: ``` [server] root_url = http://my.dashboard.server/grafana ``` 4. Configure the plugin as follows: * Http settings: * Url: http://my.dashboard.server/monitoring/proxy (i.e. your dashboard's `/metrics/proxy` base URL) * Access: direct * Authentication * Auth: Horizon Steps (2) and (3) are neccessary to ensure both Grafana and Horizon are on the same Host/Port from the browser's perspective. Otherwise the browser's XSS protection mechanisms will omit the Horizon session cookie from from any requests triggered by the `monasca-grafana-datasource` plugin. ### Keystone Authentication ### Keystone Token

zuul.projects was recently moved to a dictionary, so looping over
it needs some fixes in order to have openstackclient-check-plugins
working again.

commit_message:
Change manila post_test_hook to use plugin repo

Fix in order for the tempest jobs run manila's
tempest plugin from the new plugin repository.

Change-Id: Id07f965e5b73d20ca99e75760d196d55c7b6fbc8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph refs/changes/81/514381/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo -H -u $USER tox -eall -- $MANILA_TESTS --concurrency=$MANILA_TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY

subject: Specify management IP addresses per amphora

'}, {'number': 37, 'created': '2017-11-15 17:39:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/dcc957b631b27c0ff9faf50c9648a280ba3ac8b9', 'message': "Specify management IP addresses per amphora

The Amphora REST agent has binded to '0.0.0.0', instead of specifically
to lb_management network IP addresses.

This patch resolves this by allocating a port in the management network
prior to calling Nova boot, then passing its IP address within the
Amphora's jinja configuration file. To preserve current behavior, each
agent binds to all N management networks, using an equal number of ports.

The neutron driver (base.py) is slightly extended to support port creation
and deletion.

Closes-Bug: #1489963

Change-Id: If4f707471c6410af65aacec830f0c59db2806a96
"}, {'number': 38, 'created': '2017-11-15 23:16:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/c61caa47a38e2ef75364dcde9503c1d9f5191070', 'message': "Specify management IP addresses per amphora

The Amphora REST agent has binded to '0.0.0.0', instead of specifically
to lb_management network IP addresses.

This patch resolves this by allocating a port in the management network
prior to calling Nova boot, then passing its IP address within the
Amphora's jinja configuration file. To preserve current behavior, each
agent binds to all N management networks, using an equal number of ports.

The neutron driver (base.py) is slightly extended to support port creation
and deletion.

Closes-Bug: #1489963

Change-Id: If4f707471c6410af65aacec830f0c59db2806a96
"}, {'number': 39, 'created': '2017-11-17 17:29:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/cd2764bab57ee90a4748b1b909f3013526b09541', 'message': "Specify management IP addresses per amphora

The Amphora REST agent has binded to '0.0.0.0', instead of specifically
to lb_management network IP addresses.

This patch resolves this issue by allocating a port in the management
network prior to calling Nova boot, then passing its IP address within the
Amphora's jinja configuration file. To preserve current behavior, each
agent binds to all N management networks, using an equal number of ports.

The agent will henceforth read from bind_host_list instead of the global bind_host which is due for deprecation.

The neutron driver (base.py) is slightly extended to support port creation
and deletion.

Closes-Bug: #1489963

commit_message:
Specify management IP addresses per amphora

The Amphora REST agent has binded to '0.0.0.0', instead of specifically
to lb_management network IP addresses.

This patch resolves this issue by allocating a port in the management
network prior to calling Nova boot, then passing its IP address within the
Amphora's jinja configuration file. To preserve current behavior, each
agent binds to all N management networks, using an equal number of ports.

The agent will henceforth read from bind_host_list instead of the global
bind_host which is due for deprecation.

The neutron driver (base.py) is slightly extended to support port creation
and deletion.

Task: 5388
Story: 1489963

Change-Id: If4f707471c6410af65aacec830f0c59db2806a96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/58/505158/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove swift legacy tox jobs

The swift legacy tox jobs have been moved in-tree and converted to Zuul
v3. Remove them here.

Remove also the openstack-tox-py27/py35 jobs, the swift jobs replace
them. We need special versions for them to pass in TMPDIR to the set up
xfs mount point. Remove the python-jobs and python-jobs35 templates, we
just need pep8 and publish tar ball jobs here.

Also, update swift-bench: It can use the openstack-python-jobs template,
no need to list jobs itself.

Change-Id: Id2b5cff998ac3a825a8f515c7bae3b433f30d272
Depends-On: I34ed9e1c4b822f700e42fb07937df7be72cbaf4e
Needed-By: Ifd0de2e4a7551c596a4c56ab54910c4a6dd8621a

commit_message:
Update the default value for enable_openvswitch

The valid options for neutron_plugin_agent are openvswitch, linuxbridge,
vmware_nsxv, vmware_dvs or opendaylight, refer to [0]. DVS and
opendaylight requires openvswitch, but NSX need to disable openvswitch,
just refer to [1]. so the condition "{{ neutron_plugin_agent != 'linuxbridge' }}"
is not accuracy. this patch to correct it

[0] https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/etc/kolla/globals.yml#L102
[1] https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en/red-hat-openstack-platform/8/vmware-integration-guide/chapter-3-integrate-vmware-nsx-with-openstack-networking

Change-Id: Ife6b4f7fa832e7ef9f1e92a876d631fa4d00a2ea

commit_message:
Amend flavor description spec for GET /flavors API

During implementation it was realized the spec never
considered the GET /flavors API. After talking with some
stakeholders it was agreed to add the description field
to the GET flavors response, since that's a more limited
list response that a user can then use to get more details
from the GET /flavor/{flavor_id} API.

Related to blueprint flavor-description

Change-Id: I730a2759dae68ad37abb336ca544511c4f84da96

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Also, fix branch instruction for releasenotes.

Change-Id: I084faaa76e8a7a6f9f1866fa0a040357fc4f00f2

commit_message:
translations: Fix nodejs install

We're not using local install yet, so make the nodejs function handle
running in a venv.

Currently it fails with:
"Can not perform a '--user' install. User site-packages are not visible
in this virtualenv."

Change-Id: I7a62a6fb236286c967fe2fbfb0266e016d3dcecf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/07/529507/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The ensure-babel and ensure-sphinx roles create a venv in # ~/.venv containing the needed software. However, it's possible # we may want to switch that to using pip install --user and # ~/.local instead of a venv, so make this compatible with either. if [ -d ~/.venv ] ; then pip install nodeenv nodeenv --node 6.9.4 $NODE_VENV else pip install --user nodeenv ~/.local/bin/nodeenv --node 6.9.4 $NODE_VENV fi

added_lines: chdir: '{{ zuul.project.src_dir }}'
deleted_lines: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x CLONEMAP=`mktemp` function cleanup { # In cases where zuul-cloner is aborted during a git # clone operation, git will remove the git work tree in # its cleanup. The work tree in these jobs is the # workspace directory, which means that subsequent # jenkins post-build actions can not run because the # workspace has been removed. # To reduce the likelihood of this having an impact, # recreate the workspace directory if needed mkdir -p $WORKSPACE rm -f $CLONEMAP } trap cleanup EXIT cat > $CLONEMAP << EOF clonemap: - name: $ZUUL_PROJECT dest: . EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m $CLONEMAP --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org $ZUUL_PROJECT executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

commit_message:
Add tempest tests for '--remove-from-date'

This adds a series of new integration tests to verify the behavior of
'--remove-from-date' in combination with several other flags,
including '--no-incremental', '--always-level', and '--max-level'.

Change-Id: I03fc8487934e0118db5a1f7044e880fc8121702a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/65/334665/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (C) Copyright 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from datetime import datetime, timedelta from tempest import test from freezer.tests.freezer_tempest_plugin.tests.api import base def iso_days_ago_trimmed(days): """Get an ISO formatted date string for `days` days ago This returns the date `days` prior to the current system time in a format suitable for freezer-agent's `--remove-from-date`. That is, with fractional seconds removed from the end. :param days: the number of days prior to the current system time :return: an ISO-formatted date string with no fractional seconds """ date = datetime.now() - timedelta(days=days) iso = date.isoformat() return iso.split('.')[0] class TestFreezerRemoveDate(base.BaseFreezerTest): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(TestFreezerRemoveDate, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) # noinspection PyAttributeOutsideInit def setUp(self): super(TestFreezerRemoveDate, self).setUp() self.environ = super(TestFreezerRemoveDate, self).get_environ() self.backup_name = 'backup_remove_test' @test.attr(type="gate") def test_freezer_remove_from_date_no_incremental(self): should_remove = [ self.create_mutated_backup(incremental=False, days_old=60) ] should_remain = [ self.create_mutated_backup(incremental=False, days_old=14), self.create_mutated_backup(incremental=False, days_old=7), self.create_mutated_backup(incremental=False, days_old=1) ] self.run_subprocess([ 'freezer-agent', '--action', 'admin', '--container', self.storage.path, '--remove-from-date', iso_days_ago_trimmed(30), '--storage', 'local', '--backup-name', self.backup_name, ], 'Remove backups older than 30 days') for i, metadata in enumerate(should_remain): parent, files = base.resolve_paths(metadata) self.assertIsNotNone(parent, 'Backup with timestamp {} (#{}) should still ' 'exist'.format(metadata['time_stamp'], i)) for i, metadata in enumerate(should_remove): parent, files = base.resolve_paths(metadata) self.assertIsNone(parent, 'Backup with timestamp {} (#{}) should be ' 'removed'.format(metadata['time_stamp'], i)) @test.attr(type="gate") def test_freezer_remove_from_date_incremental(self): # for incremental backups, backups older than the requested removal # date should not be removed if they are referenced by backups that # will remain # note: order of backup dates is important here (i.e. oldest first) # all subsequent backups are put in the data directory of the first # chronological backup, so we should make sure to produce a realistic # directory structure should_remain = [ self.create_mutated_backup(incremental=True, days_old=60), self.create_mutated_backup(incremental=True, days_old=14), self.create_mutated_backup(incremental=True, days_old=7), self.create_mutated_backup(incremental=True, days_old=1) ] self.run_subprocess([ 'freezer-agent', '--action', 'admin', '--container', self.storage.path, '--remove-from-date', iso_days_ago_trimmed(30), '--storage', 'local', '--backup-name', self.backup_name, ], 'Remove backups older than 30 days') for i, metadata in enumerate(should_remain): parent, files = base.resolve_paths(metadata) self.assertIsNotNone(parent, 'Backup with timestamp {} (#{}) should still ' 'exist'.format(metadata['time_stamp'], i)) @test.attr(type="gate") def test_freezer_remove_from_date_always_level_trivial(self): # these backups should be removed since all backups fall before the # removal date should_remove = [ self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=55), # L0 self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=50), # L1 self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=45), # L2 self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=40), # L3 self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=35), # L3 ] self.run_subprocess([ 'freezer-agent', '--action', 'admin', '--container', self.storage.path, '--remove-from-date', iso_days_ago_trimmed(30), '--storage', 'local', '--backup-name', self.backup_name, ], 'Remove backups older than 30 days') for i, metadata in enumerate(should_remove): parent, files = base.resolve_paths(metadata) self.assertIsNone(parent, 'Backup with timestamp {} (#{}) should be ' 'removed'.format(metadata['time_stamp'], i)) @test.attr(type="gate") def test_freezer_remove_from_date_always_level(self): # while L3 backups are dependent on L2...L0, they should not be # dependent on other L3 backups # other backups at the max level (L3) *should* be safely removable # these backups are old enough to be removed. but must stay as long as # dependent backups exist should_remain = [ self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=60), # L0 self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=55), # L1 self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=50), # L2 ] # this backup falls after the removal date and could be removed safely # since no other backups depend on it should_remove = [ self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=40), # L3 ] # these backups fall after the removal date, and should always remain should_remain += [ self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=15), # L3 self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=10), # L3 self.create_mutated_backup(always_level=3, days_old=5) # L3 ] self.run_subprocess([ 'freezer-agent', '--action', 'admin', '--container', self.storage.path, '--remove-from-date', iso_days_ago_trimmed(30), '--storage', 'local', '--backup-name', self.backup_name, ], 'Remove backups older than 30 days') for i, metadata in enumerate(should_remove): parent, files = base.resolve_paths(metadata) self.assertIsNone(parent, 'Backup with timestamp {} (#{}) should be ' 'removed'.format(metadata['time_stamp'], i)) for i, metadata in enumerate(should_remain): parent, files = base.resolve_paths(metadata) self.assertIsNotNone(parent, 'Backup with timestamp {} (#{}) should ' 'exist'.format(metadata['time_stamp'], i)) @test.attr(type="gate") def test_freezer_remove_from_date_max_level(self): should_remove = [] should_remain = [] # should be trivially removed since all backup levels fall behind the # removal boundary should_remove.extend([ self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=65), self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=60), self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=55), self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=50), ]) # backups with recent levels falling before the removal boundary should # remain, since this would otherwise break incremental backups should_remain.extend([ self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=40), self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=35), self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=30), self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=25), ]) # backups falling entirely before the removal date should always remain should_remain.extend([ self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=20), self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=15), self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=10), self.create_mutated_backup(max_level=3, days_old=5) ]) self.run_subprocess([ 'freezer-agent', '--action', 'admin', '--container', self.storage.path, '--remove-from-date', iso_days_ago_trimmed(30), '--storage', 'local', '--backup-name', self.backup_name, ], 'Remove backups older than 30 days') for i, metadata in enumerate(should_remove): parent, files = base.resolve_paths(metadata) self.assertIsNone(parent, 'Backup with timestamp {} (#{}) should be ' 'removed'.format(metadata['time_stamp'], i)) for i, metadata in enumerate(should_remain[1:]): parent, files = base.resolve_paths(metadata) self.assertIsNotNone(parent, 'Backup with timestamp {} (#{}) should still ' 'exist'.format(metadata['time_stamp'], i))

commit_message:
Don't specify a path for the freezer cli in tests.

This helps making the tests more compatible accross
different platforms. Instead of a fixed path, the
PATH environment variable will be used.

Change-Id: Ia3c9536c12834b0487aae07b1df975673cbd6d80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/44/332044/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update the Freezer FAQ.rst

Change-Id: I8b346bbe71ce5315e2cb980735aa0640cb750071
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/84/304284/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Freezer is a Backup Restore DR as a Service platform that helps you to automate the data backup and restore process. Yes. Incremental backup are done using GNU tar incremental features. Freezer checks for changes at mtime and ctime in every file inode to evaluate if a file changed or not. Both approaches are good. Rsync checks the file content, while tar checks the file inode. In our Tar is fast as it needs to check only the file inodes, rather than the full file content. Rsync backup type will be added pretty soon. 5) **Does freezer support encrypted backup?** Freezer requires journal to be enabled in Mongo and data to be stored on an lvm volume. It checks if the Mongo instance is the master and createsa an lvm snapshot to have consistent data. Yes. Zeroed/null data are not backed up so less space and bandwidth will be used. Yes. From command line the option --remove-older-than (days) can be used to remove objects older than (days). Yes. Freezer has a REST API and a Web UI integrated with Horizon.16) **Is Freezer an official OpenStack project?** Yes, Freezer is part of the OpenStack Big Tent. Yes. The freezer agent and scheduler can be executed on Windows. Currently VSS is used to support point in time snapshots. 19) **What applications are supported in Windows for consistent backups?** SQL Server (--mode sqlserver) and MySQL. If you want to use the freezer-api and freezer-web-ui in horizon, you need to use the freezer-scheduler. If you do not need the api and web ui, you can just execute the freezer-agent from crontab or any other scheduler. - You can start backup and restore jobs on any node from the Web UI. - Backup jobs can be synchronized across multiple nodes. - The UI provides metrics and other info. We recommend instead creating "exec"-type action as part of a job.
deleted_lines: Is a tool to automate data backup and restore process using OpenStack Swift and/or other media storage Yes. Incremental backup are done using GNU tar incremental features Freezer check for changes at mtime and ctime in every file inode to evaluate if a file changed or not. Both approaches are good. Rsync check the file content, while tar check the file inode. In our Tar is fast as it needs to check only the file inodes, rather then the full file content. Rsync backup type will be added pretty soon 5) *Does freezer support encrypted backup?* Freezer required journal enabled in Mongo and lvm volume to execute backup. It checks if the Mongo instance is the master and create lvm snapshot to have consistent data. Yes. Zeroed/null data is not backed up. So less space and bandwidth will be used. Yes. From command line the option --remove-older-then (days) can be used to remove objects older then (days). Yes. Freezer has REST API and a Web UI integrated with Horizon16) **Will Freezer be included as official project in OpenStack?** We hope so, as soon as we can. Yes. The freezer agent and scheduler can be executed on Windows Curretnly VSS are used to support point in time snapshots 19) **What applications are supported in Windows for consisten backups?** SQL Server (--mode sqlserver) If you want to use the freezer-api and freezer-web-ui in horizon, you need to use the freezer-scheduler. If you do not need the api and web ui, you can just execute the freezer-agent from crontab or any other scheduler. - You can start backup and restore jobs on any node from the Web UI - Backup jobs can be synchronized across multiple nodes - The UI provides metrics and other info We recommend instead creating "exec"-type jobs in the UI and set up job dependencies.

commit_message:
Elasticsearch backup

Change-Id: I63e78f1d80fac3c7b8c6018e014f6c4e232c4fbb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/22/439922/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from freezer.mode import mode from freezer.utils import config import elasticsearch class ElasticsearchMode(mode.Mode): """ Execute an Elasticsearch backup using the snapshot mechanism available. """ @property def name(self): return "elasticsearch" @property def version(self): return "1.0" def release(self): if not self.released: pass def prepare(self): self.released = False pass def __init__(self, conf): """ :param conf: """ try: import elasticsearch except ImportError: raise ImportError('Please install Elasticsearch module') self.host = conf.es_host self.es = elasticsearch.Elasticsearch(hosts=self.host) self.snapshot = conf.es_snasphot # default freezer_timestamp self.path = conf.path_to_backup def create_snapshot_repository(self): """ Before any snapshot or restore operation can be performed, a snapshot repository should be registered :return: """ repository_desc = { 'type': 'fs', 'location': self.path, 'compress': True, 'max_snapshot_bytes_per_sec': '50mb', 'max_restore_bytes_per_sec': '50mb' } try: return self.es.snapshot.create_repository(repository=self.snapshot, body=repository_desc) except elasticsearch.TransportError as error: raise elasticsearch.TransportError(error.message) def delete_snapshot_repository(self, repository): """ :param repository: :return: """ try: self.es.snapshot.delete_repository(repository=repository) except elasticsearch.TransportError as error: raise elasticsearch.TransportError(error.message) def create_snapshot(self, indices): """ :param indices: list of indices :return: """ repository = self.create_snapshot_repository() indices_to_backup = { "indices": indices } try: self.es.snapshot.create(repository=repository, snapshot=self.snapshot, body=indices_to_backup) except elasticsearch.TransportError as error: raise elasticsearch.TransportError(error.message) def delete_snapshot(self, repository, snapshot): try: self.es.snapshot.delete(repository=repository, snapshot=snapshot) except elasticsearch.TransportError as error: raise elasticsearch.TransportError(error.message)

commit_message:
Add test of mysql backup

Add a Tempest test to test mysql backup.

Change-Id: I21e3dacffc3b33658c9a5b02d0be28bcdcf33c50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/92/304292/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
# (C) Copyright 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import shutil import datetime import subprocess from freezer.tests.freezer_tempest_plugin.tests.api import base from tempest import test class TestFreezerMysqlBackup(base.BaseFreezerTest): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(TestFreezerMysqlBackup, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) def setUp(self): super(TestFreezerMysqlBackup, self).setUp() now_in_secs = datetime.datetime.now().strftime("%s") self.freezer_mysql_conf_file_path = ('/tmp/.freezer/db.conf/' + now_in_secs) self.freezer_mysql_conf_file_name = \ self.freezer_mysql_conf_file_path + "/" + "mysql_db_conf" shutil.rmtree(self.freezer_mysql_conf_file_path, True) os.makedirs(self.freezer_mysql_conf_file_path) with open(self.freezer_mysql_conf_file_name, "w") as mysql_db_conf: mysql_db_conf.write('host=localhost
') mysql_db_conf.write('user=root
') mysql_db_conf.write('password=secretmysql
') self.restore_target_dir = ( "/tmp/freezer-test-backup-restore/" + now_in_secs) self.freezer_mysql_src_vol = '/dev/mysqlvg/mysqlvol' self.freezer_lv_dirmount = '/var/snapshot-backup' self.freezer_lvm_volgroup = 'mysqlvg' self.freezer_path_to_backup = '/var/snapshot-backup' self.freezer_container_name = 'freezer-test-container-mysql-0' self.freezer_backup_name = 'freezer-test-backup-mysql-0' self.freezer_mysql_conf_file = '/tmp/.freezer/freezer-mysql.conf' shutil.rmtree(self.restore_target_dir, True) os.makedirs(self.restore_target_dir) def tearDown(self): super(TestFreezerMysqlBackup, self).tearDown() shutil.rmtree(self.freezer_mysql_conf_file_name, True) @test.attr(type="gate") def test_freezer_mysql_backup(self): backup_args = ['freezer-agent', '--lvm-srcvol', self.freezer_mysql_src_vol, '--lvm-dirmount', self.freezer_lv_dirmount, '--lvm-volgroup', self.freezer_lvm_volgroup, '--path-to-backup', self.freezer_path_to_backup, '--mysql-conf', self.freezer_mysql_conf_file_name, '--container', self.freezer_container_name, '--backup-name', self.freezer_backup_name] backup_rc = subprocess.call(backup_args, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, env=self.environ, shell=False) self.assertEqual(0, backup_rc, "Test mysql backup to swift and " "restore")

added_lines: # (C) Copyright 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testtools from tempest.common import compute from tempest.common import image from tempest.common import waiters from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest.scenario import manager from tempest import test import tempest CONF = config.CONF class TestNovaInstance(manager.ScenarioTest): """Test nova backups and restore """ @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(TestNovaInstance, cls).skip_checks() # if not CONF.compute_feature_enabled.shelve: # raise cls.skipException("Shelve is not available.") def backup(self, server): waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.servers_client, server['id'], 'ACTIVE') def _create_server_then_backup_and_restore(self, boot_from_volume=False): keypair = self.create_keypair() security_group = self._create_security_group() security_groups = [{'name': security_group['name']}] server = self.create_server( key_name=keypair['name'], security_groups=security_groups, volume_backed=boot_from_volume) instance_ip = self.get_server_ip(server) timestamp = self.create_timestamp(instance_ip, private_key=keypair['private_key']) # Prevent bug #1257594 from coming back # Unshelve used to boot the instance with the original image, not # with the instance snapshot self.backup(server) timestamp2 = self.get_timestamp(instance_ip, private_key=keypair['private_key']) self.assertEqual(timestamp, timestamp2) @decorators.attr(type='slow') @decorators.idempotent_id('1164e700-0af0-4a4c-8792-35909a88743c') @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.network.public_network_id, 'The public_network_id option must be specified.') @test.services('compute', 'network', 'image') def test_backuo_instance(self): self._create_server_then_backup_and_restore() @decorators.attr(type='slow') @decorators.idempotent_id('c1b6318c-b9da-490b-9c67-9339b627271f') @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.network.public_network_id, 'The public_network_id option must be specified.') @test.services('compute', 'volume', 'network', 'image') def test_backup_volume_backed_instance(self): self._create_server_then_backup_and_restore(boot_from_volume=True)

commit_message:
Adding PostgreSQL support

This adds support for a PostgreSQL backup. It makes use of the
CHECKPOINT feature. The agent is invoked similarly to the MySQL
backup mode.

Change-Id: I90a2e72034872123df263ade9afddb0a8c19d6a7
Implements: blueprint postgres-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/72/501272/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (c) Copyright 2015-2017 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from freezer.mode import mode from freezer.utils import config class PostgresqlMode(mode.Mode): """ Execute a PostgreSQL DB backup. currently only backup with lvm snapshots are supported. This mean, just before the lvm snap vol is created, a CHECKPOINT is beeing creating. It is important to have the available in backup_args.postgresql_conf the file where the database host, name, user, password and port are set. """ @property def name(self): return "postgresql" @property def version(self): return "1.0" def release(self): pass def prepare(self): self.released = False self.cursor = self.postgresql_db_inst.cursor() self.cursor.execute('CHECKPOINT') self.postgresql_db_inst.commit() def __init__(self, conf): try: import psycopg2 as PostgreSQL except ImportError: raise ImportError('Please install Psycopg2 module') with open(conf.postgresql_conf, 'r') as postgresql_file_fd: parsed_config = config.ini_parse(postgresql_file_fd) # Initialize the DB object and connect to the db according to # the db postgresql backup file config self.released = False try: self.postgresql_db_inst = PostgreSQL.connect( host=parsed_config.get("host", False), port=int(parsed_config.get("port", 3306)), user=parsed_config.get("user", False), password=parsed_config.get("password", False), database='postgres') self.cursor = None except Exception as error: raise Exception('postgresql: {0}'.format(error))

So override branch can be 'stable/mitaka' but we can # test master changes. uc_project=`echo $DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT | tr [:lower:] [:upper:] | tr '-' '_' | sed 's/[^A-Z_]//'` export "OVERRIDE_"$uc_project"_PROJECT_BRANCH"=$ZUUL_BRANCH function gate_hook { source $BASE/new/$ZUUL_SHORT_PROJECT_NAME/devstack/gate_hook.sh } export -f gate_hook cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

commit_message:
Replace .testr.conf with .stestr.conf

In this change [1] os_testr changed under the covers from using
testr to stestr, so that we now get the following warning:

 ostestr.py:120:
 UserWarning: No .stestr.conf file found in the CWD.
 Please create one to to replace the .testr.conf. You can find a
 script to do this in the stestr git repository.

So remove the .testr.conf and add .stestr.conf which was
generated using a utility script as documented here [2].

[1] Id7cb2a39a8308f1413608dcf19273a1d7f33592e
[2] https://media.readthedocs.org/pdf/stestr/stable/stestr.pdf

Change-Id: I64e2ad475606d42eeb1c232f0a8e3a37989661bb

Change to check for trickle executable using the PATH environment
variable only once, since default of path=None will get the PATH

commit_message:
Check PATH only once for trickle

Change to check for trickle executable using the PATH environment
variable only once, since default of path=None will get the PATH
variable behind the scenes anyway.

Replace nested if statements with a simple loop for easier addition of
paths to include in search in future.

Ensure os.pathsep is used as specified in the documentation for
find_executable.

Change-Id: Ibc4f33499f61d91c671efe36a2f996ee71d48554
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/05/321005/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # locate trickle - path arg not defined means use os.environ['PATH'] for tsp in ([], sys.path): 'trickle', path=(os.pathsep.join(tsp) if tsp else None)) if trickle_executable is not None: break
deleted_lines: # locate trickle trickle_executable = distspawn.find_executable('trickle') if trickle_executable is None: 'trickle', path=":".join(sys.path)) if trickle_executable is None: trickle_executable = distspawn.find_executable( 'trickle', path=":".join(os.environ.get('PATH')))

commit_message:
Enhance freezer-dr

Change-Id: I6b6af0441a5bc40a4bec3df84965de736ab719b9
Signed-off-by: Saad Zaher <eng.szaher@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-specs refs/changes/71/460271/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ====================== Disaster Recovery ====================== This blueprint introduces the DR capability to Freezer. The concept of DR is quite large and various approaches are possible. In Freezer has always been approached the “restore” your systems in case of disaster. Even if this approach is fine in some cases, it’s the cheapest approach, but sometimes this is not an acceptable (RTO/RPO requirements) and a less invasive solution is needed (usually more expensive to build and maintain) to achieve smaller RTO/RPO’s. Goals ------ 1) Leverage OpenStack capability to monitor the status of the compute nodes and provide the functionality of automatic/manual node evacuation in case of failure of a compute node. 2) Evacuate an entire data center or, in case is needed, even live migrate the instances from a DC to another DC. 3) Support minimum 2 DC in both active/active and active/passive DC configuration. 4) The floating IP’s internet routing need to be redirected to the DR DC in case of disaster/migration of workload. Requirements ------------- 1) Assume we have an OpenStack Cloud deployed on 2 different DC, and the controllers split between the two sites, share (need to be replicated) the same DB, Block Storage and Object Storage. - OS DB should be replicated over the DC that are part of the DR solution, this is needed so that all the OS services can be consistent on all DC's (ex. cinder will see the same volumes on all sites). This can be done in master-master or master-slave, to meet eventually specific requirements. - Block storage used as Cinder backend need to be configured implemented in a distributed way over the sites that are part of the DR - Object storage need to be distributed, same as block storage - Glance backend follow the same pattern as block/object storage - In case of ephemeral storage on compute nodes, as per evacuation requirements, need to be on a shared storage (ex. mounted via nfs) that need to be replicated over the DC’s. 3) Each node resolve the controllers/db/storage nodes names with IP located in the same DC (ex. Using a loadbalancer or GeoDNS or ad hoc /etc/hosts). 4) In case of 2 DC implementation the split brain problem arises in case of disaster in one DC on storage cluster and DB's. For this reason, usually, some action need to be taken on the storage cluster and DB to gain quorum after the disaster occurs. Implementation ------------------ In freezer-agent we need to implement a reporting mechanism that during the usual polling on the API, the status of the hypervisor (if this functionality is enabled) should be added to the normal response. In the freezer-api there should be a separate process/thread that implement the functionality explained in Goal 1 and 2. Goal 1 ----------- The following diagram shows the algorithm that can be used to achieve goal 1. .. image:: failover.png The architecture should be pluggable, at least for the: - Evacuation - Fencing - Monitoring - Notifications All this components of the workflow should be loadable as plugins and be able to use multiple plugins at the same time (ex. have multiple monitoring systems checked before the evacuations). This is very important for the platform to be customizable simply writing a new plugin to implement specific behaviors or integrating different technologies. Both automatic evacuation and manual evacuation should be supported. Goal 2 ----------------- Once the part regarding the goal 1 is implemented, the same mechanism of evacuation but in larger scale can be leveraged to evacuate an entire DC. This workflow need to be implemented in an elastic and adaptable way. The following architecture could be a reference example: .. image:: dr.png In case of a disaster on one of the two DC at least the following actions need to be taken: - Before activating the DR workflow, some actions possibly need to be taken to avoid the failed DC to go back online and create a conflict with the DR site. Since the nature of the disaster can be of various form, this activity is extremely difficult to automate and too few assumptions can be taken (ex. the failed site is not any more remotely accessible) - Turn on all the compute nodes in the DR site, via ipmi, cobbler, ironic and/or other mechanisms. This can be extended in future implementations to use ironic, cobbler (or alternative) to deploy compute nodes that can be shared between different OpenStack instances! (if RTO/RPO meet the additional time needed to do so) - Interact with the database to gather the quorum on the DR site (ex.: elect to master the slaves) - Interact with the block storage (ceph in the previous example) to gather the quorum (ex. remove the nodes from the failed DC) and possibly decrease the number of replica (ex.: from 3 to 2) to alleviate the replication that get triggered by this action - Interact with the object storage (swift, ceph or alternatives) to gather the quorum on the DR site (if ceph is used for bot block-object this is probably not needed). - Orchestrate the evacuation of the nodes from the failed DC to the DR site. - Using anycast or similar, change the shortest path of the ip/networks affected by the failure to the DR site. Similar as the approach for Goal 1, the implementation of previous actions, the following components need to be pluggable (to be easily extensible, customizable and configurable): - Power management (turn on nodes on DR site, using ipmi or alternative methods). - Database management - Block storage management - Object storage management - Evacuation (sharing code with goal 1 implementation) - Routing management (anycast, BGP, OSPF ....) ========================== Architecture ========================== .. image:: DR_Freezer_arch_03.png Reference --------------- http://galeracluster.com/2015/07/geo-distributed-database-clusters-with-galera/ http://docs.openstack.org/arch-design/multi-site-user-requirements.html http://docs.openstack.org/arch-design/multi-site-user-requirements.html#workload-characteristics http://docs.openstack.org/openstack-ops/content/scaling.html https://openstack.nimeyo.com/58101/openstack-operators-milti-site-keystone-%26-galera

commit_message:
Initial commit for openstack-client support in python-freezerclient

This patch enables openstack-client support in python-freezerclient
by setting entry points and implementing two interface functions

Partially implements: blueprint openstack-client-support-in-python-freezerclient

Change-Id: I286893c9f5fec727ab404c85cdcb875d993a8b71
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-freezerclient refs/changes/04/451804/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """OpenStackClient plugin for Backup service.""" from openstackclient.common import utils from oslo_log import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) DEFAULT_BACKUP_API_VERSION = "1" API_VERSION_OPTION = "os_backup_api_version" API_NAME = "backup" API_VERSIONS = { '1': 'freezerclient.v1.client.Client', } def make_client(instance): """Returns an backup service client""" backup_client = utils.get_client_class( API_NAME, instance._api_version[API_NAME], API_VERSIONS) LOG.debug("Instantiating backup client: {0}".format( backup_client)) client = backup_client( region_name=instance._region_name, session=instance.session, service_type='backup', ) return client def build_option_parser(parser): """Hook to add global options""" parser.add_argument( '--os-backup-api-version', metavar='<backup-api-version>', default=utils.env( 'OS_BACKUP_API_VERSION', default=DEFAULT_BACKUP_API_VERSION), help=_("Backup API version, default={0}" "(Env:OS_BACKUP_API_VERSION)").format( DEFAULT_BACKUP_API_VERSION)) return parser

commit_message:
Replace uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

As of now, UUID is being generated using either uuid.uuid4()
or uuidutils.generate_uuid(). In order to maintain consistency,
we propose to use uuidutils.generate_uuid() from oslo_utils.

Change-Id: Ie9f60d7387207a3a67eb58f7b844ace3815a0976
Closes-bug: #1082248

commit_message:
Better installation instructions

This fix contains lots of installation instructions and fixed. I have
personally confirmed that earlier installation instructions does lack
lots of importent points. Because I have stuck bunch of times just
because there is not enough or correct information.

Change-Id: Ia9170e2ad39f85993fab6205684a2d6b8a489390
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-api refs/changes/24/294924/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This is Freezer API which is one of the four OpenStack Freezer Backup Restore DR as a Service platform. This component of OpenStack Freezer is responsible to connecting Freezer Scheduler (on client side) with Freezer Web UI. You can also use Frezer API to interact with Freezer Scheduler. If you need to understand OpenStack Freezer architecture you can visit https://github.com/openstack/freezer If you are planning to use Freezer as OpenStack Freezer Backup Restore DR as a Service, you need to install all four components. You can find other components of the project at following pages: Freezer Scheduler & Freezer Agent https://github.com/openstack/freezer Freezer Web UI (Horizon Dashbuard Plugin) https://github.com/openstack/freezer-web-ui 0. Before Installation0. Before Installation =============== Before starting installation, please read following point carefully: :: 1. Chose correct branch for corresponding OpenStack version. If your OpenStack installation is Kilo, chose Stable/Kilo release. etc... 2. This installation instruction only for Freeze API. If you need to install other components, visit their Github page. 3. Make sure you have installed same version of all four components. Do not miss match different version. For example; do not use Freezer Agent Stable/Kilo release with Freeze API Stable/Liberty release. 5. Following installation instructions only for Freezer API. 6. Freezr API need Freezer Agent in order to word correctly. You can find installation instruction for Freeze Agent in this manuel. 7. You should install Freeze API in one of your OpenStack controller node where you have installed Horizon Dashbuard and Keystone 8. Freezer API does not work with Elasticsearch 2.x.x. Install Elasticsearch 1.7.5 1.1 Clone Freezer API & Install Required Packages ------------------------------------------------- # apt-get install python-pip # apt-get install git # cd freezer-apiYou also need to install Freezer Agent. Freezer Agent must be installed from source and correct branch corresponding to your OpenStack version. :: # git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/freezer.git # cd freezer # pip install -r requirements.txt # sudo python setup.py install 1.2 Install Freezer API from Source ----------------------------------- :: # cd freezer-api # sudo python setup.py install 1.3 Edit Config FileConfig file contains all the necessary information. Read the comments carefully and adjust the config accordingly. 1.4 Install/Setup and Configure Database ---------------------------------------- The currently Freezer API only supports Elasticsearch 1.7.5. Install proper Elasticsearch version: :: # wget https://download.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch/elasticsearch-1.7.5.deb # dpkg -i elasticsearch-1.7.5.deb After installation you need to start elasticsearch: Before starting database init process please consider following topics: :: # 1. Elasticsearch does not have proper authentication so you need to close 9200 and 9300 ports to outside. # 2. as [db-host] user "localhost" and make sure localhost mapped to 127.0.0.1 Initialize freezer-db1.5 Run Freezer API Instance ---------------------------- Before running freezer-api, you must source proper OpenStack environment. Because freezer-api need to reach OpenStack keystone in admin level. You can use "freezer-api [IP Address]" to bind freezer api to spesific IP. In order to achieve high availability on OpenStack Control Nodes, you may user HA Proxy. Do not put your freezer-api IP behind any kind of proxy. Your Freezer system may not work correctly. Do not forget to register API endpoint for freezer-api. For API registration check "4. API registration" at below. Freezer Scheduler and Freezer Web UI need to know freezer-api endpoint to work correctly. Register API Endpoints to Keystone: You can use admin user if you do not want to create freezer user. If you have not created admin user make sure your freezer-api.conf is configured accordingly.
deleted_lines: 1.1 Install required packages ----------------------------- # cd freezer-api && sudo python setup.py install 1.2 Install freezer_api ----------------------- :: 1.3 edit config file 1.4 setup/configure the db -------------------------- The currently supported db is Elasticsearch. In case you are using a dedicated instance of the server, you'll need to start it. Depending on the OS flavor it might be a:To do that, use the freezer-db-init command:1.5 run simple instance -----------------------

commit_message:
Backing up freezer's index in elasticsearch

Change-Id: I48a443b9555e4fcfc088179cdaa7d297f64dad88
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-api refs/changes/65/440765/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Backup: backup index Restore: restore index def backup(self): """Backup an index from elasticsearch. Backup freezer's index in elasticsearch is done by pulling out of the data from the index. We decided to go this way in this iteration to avoid being intrusive in the ES configuration due that not all of the clusters have available the path.repo setting that is required to create snapshots. :return: """ # scroll through all of the entries in the index # download them into a file # create a job for freezer # freezer backup. pass def restore(self): """Restore an index to elasticsearch. Restoring data will consists in a bulk insert of data to the index. For that a clean index is required. :return: """ # freezer restore # check if index exists # if so: delete it # create index from the configuration # bulk-insert data pass

commit_message:
Implement migrations and config opts for oslo.db

Database can be created and all the tables
migrated to latest versions using
freezer-manage db sync command.
Introduced state_path configuration option which
is used as a physical path to database.
Introduced sql group in config file which should
contain all the oslo.db backend-related parameters,
such as connection for database.

Implements: blueprint oslo-db

Change-Id: I194860a2f9efa3e6ce552351993257f1aedb54a4

DELETE requests for non-existent IDs will now return HTTP 404

Change-Id: I9efd46651f96a593444caabb477bb6128b76ed99
Closes-Bug: #1596935
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-api refs/changes/77/337077/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_on_delete_returns_204(self): """Check that we get HTTP 204 on successful delete HTTP 204 requests don't contain a message body, so there's no point in checking for one as the web server will/should remove it anyway. """ backup_id = fake_data_0_backup_id self.mock_db.delete_backup.return_value = backup_id self.resource.on_delete(self.mock_req, self.mock_req, backup_id) self.assertEqual(self.mock_req.status, falcon.HTTP_204) def test_on_delete_returns_404_when_not_found(self): """Check that we get an error on delete of non-existent backup Need to test for a DocumentNotFound exception (which will become a HTTP 404) should the database driver fail to delete a record because it can't find it. """ self.mock_db.delete_backup.return_value = None self.assertRaises(DocumentNotFound, lambda: self.resource.on_delete(self.mock_req, self.mock_req, fake_data_0_backup_id))
deleted_lines: def test_on_delete_removes_proper_data(self): self.resource.on_delete(self.mock_req, self.mock_req, fake_data_0_backup_id) result = self.mock_req.body expected_result = {'backup_id': fake_data_0_backup_id} self.assertEquals(self.mock_req.status, falcon.HTTP_204) self.assertEqual(result, expected_result)

commit_message:
Fix argument order for assertEqual to (expected, observed)

assertEqual expects that the arguments provided to it should be
(expected, observed). If a particluar order is kept as a convention,
then it helps to provide a cleaner message to the developer if Unit
Tests fail. The following patch fixes this issue.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0367b09d81c6208871aa19ead9dcc3caea940c82

Changed the home-page of freezer-web-ui in setup.cfg

Instead of pointing to https://github.com/openstack/freezer-web-ui,
the homepage has been changed to point to the homepage of
freezer-web-ui.

commit_message:
Update HPE copyright

HPE commiters forgot to update the copyright to 2016.
Doing that for all files modified by an HPE employee since January 2016.

Change-Id: I91e18830e18eab02a140f58f772c89ceca549f98

commit_message:
Move legacy jobs to project

This patch implements first step in zuulv3 migration guide [1]:

Move jobs to freezer-web-ui repo

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#legacy-job-migration-details

Co-Authored-By: Nam Nguyen Hoai <namnh@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I764168378ea36d8bd757fccbb2a2d1f35f158733
Needed-By: Iea210491be3892c7c2b8bc9473a4a5ce96c6bf2d
Needed-By: I31e893beb4363e783d1ea8d7d9440e98b3c7a07b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-web-ui refs/changes/35/511135/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-osbackup-freezer-web-ui-dsvm from old job gate-osbackup-freezer-web-ui-dsvm-ubuntu-xenial tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat > clonemap.yaml << EOF clonemap: - name: openstack-infra/devstack-gate dest: devstack-gate EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m clonemap.yaml --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org \ openstack-infra/devstack-gate executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat << 'EOF' >>"/tmp/dg-local.conf" [[local|localrc]] # enable freezer-agent and freezer-scheduler enable_plugin freezer git://git.openstack.org/openstack/freezer # enable freezer-api and python-freezerclient enable_plugin freezer-api https://git.openstack.org/openstack/freezer-api # enable freezer-web-ui and python-freezerclient enable_plugin freezer-web-ui https://git.openstack.org/openstack/freezer-web-ui EOF executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true # checkout freezer components export PROJECTS="openstack/freezer-api $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/freezer-web-ui $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/freezer $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/python-freezerclient $PROJECTS" export DEVSTACK_GATE_HORIZON=1 # tempest config export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALL_PLUGINS=1 TEMPEST_REGEX="$ZUUL_SHORT_PROJECT_NAME_tempest_plugin" export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX=${TEMPEST_REGEX/\-/\_ } # which repo is being tested export DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT=$ZUUL_SHORT_PROJECT_NAME # This ensures that if we set override branch to something # else, we still take repo being tested from the zuul branch # name. So override branch can be 'stable/mitaka' but we can # test master changes. uc_project=`echo $DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT | tr [:lower:] [:upper:] | tr '-' '_' | sed 's/[^A-Z_]//'` export "OVERRIDE_"$uc_project"_PROJECT_BRANCH"=$ZUUL_BRANCH function gate_hook { source $BASE/new/$ZUUL_SHORT_PROJECT_NAME/devstack/gate_hook.sh } export -f gate_hook cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

commit_message:
Action name is required in action create form

In action create from, choose "Admin" in "Action" field, then
"Action Name" is hidden, but actually it is required. Now I fix
it.

Change-Id: I9631382f4040b9359c5d42719ef9b046c402df0f
Closes-bug: #1703590

commit_message:
Migrate special docs jobs to build-openstack-sphinx-docs

The api-ref, api-guide, deploy-guide, install-guide and
placement-api-ref docs all are just sphinx docs. Update jobs to use the
sphinx base job.

Update relevant files list to include the requirements files used.

Change-Id: I02e882786677f279c89614c2f5d295153e489a36

commit_message:
Add the cindernative backup creation to freezer web

Now the freezer has supported the cindernative backup creation,
so this patch add the cindernative backup creation to the
'Create Action' form in the freezer web.

Change-Id: I74d15a5613b48a127c2b8233035c5eeb4c6763fd

added_lines: with freezer.Freezer Dashboard requires a Freezer API and Freezer Client to be installed in the same environment as Horizon. First lets clone Freezer and install it from source:: pip install -r requirements.txt (You may need to install pip) python setup.py install (is important that freezer is installed from source and not with pip andClone Freezer Web UI and install from source:: git clone https://github.com/openstack/freezer-web-ui.git cd freezer-web-ui python setup.py install Freezer Dashboard requires a freezer API endpoints which you can install and configure with following steps below::API Endpoint Registration =========================

added_lines: ============================== Tempest integration of Octavia ==============================Installing ---------- Clone this repository to the destination machine, call from the repo:: $ pip install -e . Running the tests ----------------- To run all the tests from this plugin, call from the tempest repo:: $ tox -e all-plugin -- octavia_tempest_plugin To run a single test case, call with full path, for example:: $ tox -e all-plugin -- octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.v2.scenario.test_basic_ops.BasicOpsTest.test_basic_ops To retrieve a list of all tempest tests, run:: $ testr list-tests

commit_message:
Disable vexxhost due to job timeouts

We seem to have a lot of jobs being slow enough to hit timeouts when
running on vexxhost, disable them for now.

commit_message:
Migrate legacy jobs to project repository

See the "Legacy Job Migration Details" section of
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html

This patch moves the legacy jobs to the searchlight-ui repo where
they are redefined to use standard pre-defined zuul3 jobs.

Needed-By: I9ddcf0c5b3527b99d37fde6baedc2376db133030
Needed-By: Ia18194897380612c6b6e209218f31c10e0b37c90
Change-Id: I892614de255c1a6aee3304beafc728ac72100f4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight-ui refs/changes/59/526959/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-searchlight-ui-nodejs4-npm-run-test from old job gate-searchlight-ui-nodejs4-npm-run-test tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x CLONEMAP=`mktemp` function cleanup { # In cases where zuul-cloner is aborted during a git # clone operation, git will remove the git work tree in # its cleanup. The work tree in these jobs is the # workspace directory, which means that subsequent # jenkins post-build actions can not run because the # workspace has been removed. # To reduce the likelihood of this having an impact, # recreate the workspace directory if needed mkdir -p $WORKSPACE rm -f $CLONEMAP } trap cleanup EXIT cat > $CLONEMAP << EOF clonemap: - name: $ZUUL_PROJECT dest: . EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m $CLONEMAP --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org $ZUUL_PROJECT executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -u set -e set -x # Prerequisites sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y apt-transport-https lsb-release curl DISTRO=$(lsb_release -c -s) # Install via nodesource curl -s https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource.gpg.key | sudo apt-key add - echo "deb https://deb.nodesource.com/node_4.x $DISTRO main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list echo "deb-src https://deb.nodesource.com/node_4.x $DISTRO main" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y nodejs # Output to the log for debugging sake. node --version npm --version executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y xvfb chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y chromium-browser chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y firefox dbus chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -x sudo rm -f /etc/sudoers.d/zuul # Prove that general sudo access is actually revoked ! sudo -n true executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | DIMENSIONS='1280x1024x24' /usr/bin/Xvfb :99 -screen 0 ${DIMENSIONS} -ac +extension GLX +render -noreset 2>&1 > /dev/null & chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -u set -e set -x export DISPLAY=:99 npm install --verbose # Try running as a standard lifecycle script, otherwise try custom. npm_lifecycle_phases="publish install version test stop start restart pack" if [[ $npm_lifecycle_phases =~ (^| )test($| ) ]]; then npm test --verbose else npm run test --verbose fi # If no shrinkwrap exists, generate it. if [ ! -f ./npm-shrinkwrap.json ]; then npm prune # https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/6298 npm shrinkwrap fi executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | OUT=`git ls-files --other --exclude-standard --directory` if [ -z "$OUT" ]; then echo "No extra files created during test." exit 0 else echo "The following un-ignored files were created during the test:" echo "$OUT" exit 0 # TODO: change to 1 to fail tests. fi executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

Remove searchlight-ui legacy jobs
